item.title: Kenilworth Castle - Wikipedia
item.description: Kenilworth Castle is a castle in the town of Kenilworth in Warwickshire, England, managed by English Heritage; much of it is in ruins. The castle was founded after the Norman Conquest of 1066; with development through to the Tudor period.

item.title: Kenilworth Castle and Elizabethan Garden | English Heritage
item.description: Watch this gorgeous drone footage of Kenilworth Castle and Elizabethan Garden before you plan your visit. Listen to properties historian Dr William Wyeth explain the story of the siege of Kenilworth Castle that took place in 1266, the people who took part and its legacy today.

item.title: Visiting Kenilworth Castle: History, Ruins & Romance
item.description: Explore Kenilworth Castle’s ruins: get hours and tickets, and learn how it evolved from royal fortress in the Barons’ War to Dudley’s 1575 festivities for Elizabeth I.

item.title: Kenilworth Castle: A Historic English Fortress and Palace
item.description: Kenilworth Castle is built almost entirely from local New Red Sandstone and showcases five centuries of English military and domestic architecture. The castle’s layout includes an outer bailey, inner court, and several distinct courts and gardens, reflecting its evolution from fortress to palace.

item.title: Kenilworth Castle & Elizabethan Garden
item.description: Kenilworth Castle and its Elizabethan Gardens is the star of Kenilworth’s show and has been described as “the finest surviving example of a semi-royal palace of the later middle ages…”.

item.title: Kenilworth Castle - Royal Palaces
item.description: Kenilworth Castle was one of the greatest castles in the land – and still is despite being ruined. The first castle was built in the early 1120s on land granted by Henry I to Geoffrey de Clinton.

item.title: Kenilworth Castle - Historic UK
item.description: Kenilworth Castle was an important royalist stronghold during the English Civil War. It was eventually partially dismantled and the mere drained by parliamentary troops. The castle was presented to Kenilworth in 1958, on the 400th anniversary of the accession of Elizabeth I to the throne.

item.title: Kenilworth Castle: Medieval Castle and Elizabethan Showpiece
item.description: First built in the 1120s and a royal castle for most of its history, Kenilworth Castle was expanded by King John, John of Gaunt and Henry V. In 1563 Elizabeth I granted it to Robert Dudley,...

item.title: Kenilworth Castle (2026) - All You MUST Know Before You ... - Tripadvisor
item.description: Kenilworth Castle earns praise for its evocative ruins, beautiful gardens, and family-friendly activities, though some reviewers note high entrance fees and café queues. Many visitors highlight the historical ambiance and stunning views. While most spend around two hours there, experiences vary.

item.title: Kenilworth Castle, Warwickshire | History & Photos - Britain Express
item.description: Kenilworth Castle, Warwickshire, is one of England's most impressive medieval castles. Discover the history and visitor information of Kenilworth.
